title: 103_s1068
content: SECTION 1. ADDITIONAL TAX ON MOTOR FUELS. The text discusses a 50-cent increase in gasoline and diesel fuel taxes over the next 5 years, starting from December 31, 1993, to January 1, 1999. Additionally, it mentions the imposition of a floor stocks tax on gasoline or diesel fuel subject to tax under the Internal Revenue Code. A floor stocks tax is imposed on gasoline or diesel fuel subject to tax under the Internal Revenue Code. The tax must be paid before February 15th of the calendar year to which it relates, and all other provisions of law applicable to the taxes imposed by sections 4081 and 4091 of the Code also apply to the floor stocks tax. Definitions include that a "dealer" includes wholesalers, jobbers, distributors, or retailers, and an article is considered "held by a dealer." The tax increase calendar year is defined as any year after 1993 where the deficit reduction rate has increased. Section 4081(d)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change the year from 1995 to 1999. The tax increase calendar year is redefined as any year after 1993 when the deficit reduction rate has increased. Sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to change the year from 1995 to 1999 for various provisions related to gasoline and diesel fuel. These amendments apply to fuel removed and sold after December 31, 1993. Expansion and simplification of the Earned Income Tax Credit is proposed in Section 2. Section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow a tax credit for eligible individuals based on earned income. The credit amount is limited by the earned income amount and adjusted gross income. The tax credit under Section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code is based on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income or earned income exceeding the phaseout amount. The credit percentage and phaseout percentage are determined for taxable years after 1994. The tax credit percentages for eligible individuals with qualifying children are 34.37% for 1 child, 39.66% for 2 or more children, and 7.65% for no children. The phaseout percentages are 16.16% for 1 child, 19.83% for 2 or more children, and 7.65% for no children. In 1994, transitional percentages apply for taxable years. For an eligible individual with 1 qualifying child, the credit percentage is 26.60 and the phaseout percentage is 16.16. For 2 or more qualifying children, the credit percentage is 31.59 and the phaseout percentage is 15.79. No qualifying children. 7.65. The earned income amount and phaseout amount are determined for taxable years beginning after 1994. The earned income and phaseout amounts for eligible individuals with qualifying children are $6,000 and $11,000 for 1 child, $8,500 and $11,000 for 2 or more children, and $4,000 and $5,000 for no children. In 1994, transitional amounts apply for taxable years. For an eligible individual with 1 qualifying child, the earned income amount is $7,750 and the phaseout amount is $11,000. For an eligible individual with 2 or more qualifying children, the earned income amount is $8,500 and the phaseout amount is $11,000. The earned income amount for an eligible individual with no qualifying children is $4,000, and the phaseout amount is $5,000. The definition of an eligible individual under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include individuals with a qualifying child or those without a qualifying child if they meet certain criteria. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include eligibility criteria for individuals with a qualifying child or without a qualifying child, such as age requirements and dependency status. Inflation adjustments are also addressed in the amendments. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include eligibility criteria for individuals with a qualifying child or without a qualifying child, such as age requirements and dependency status. In the case of taxable years after 1994, dollar amounts in subsection (b)(2)(A) will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment. Additionally, paragraph (3) is redesignated as paragraph (2) and there are conforming amendments to section 32(c)(3) of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include eligibility criteria for individuals with a qualifying child or without a qualifying child. Amendments include redesignating paragraphs and making adjustments to dollar amounts for cost-of-living. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include eligibility criteria for individuals with a qualifying child or without a qualifying child, with adjustments to dollar amounts for cost-of-living. Subparagraph (B) of section 3507(c)(2) is amended to specify credit percentages and phaseout amounts for eligible individuals. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1993, regarding phaseout amounts and earned income for eligible individuals.
